bibl.note: This is a letter to H. J. Anderson from Governor James K. Polk, dated November 14, 1839. Polk is writing to discuss a prisoner at the penitentiary that Anderson is the keeper of. Anderson wants the prisoner's sentence commuted.

div.p:
Your letter of the 5th Instant stating that Lewis D. St Ledger a commit in the Penitentiary " has conducted himself with the utmost propriety"___ and recommending that his sentence be commuted, is not in strict conformity with act of 1835
ch chapter 63
sec. section 4. If you are notified (conforming to the language of the law) to certify that the conduct of the prisoner has been exemplary and unexceptionable", during the whole period of his confinement, and feel it to be proper to make such a certificate I will promptly consider of his case._

I am Very Respectfully
Your obt srt obedient servant
